Common classes attributes¶

input_file¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument input_file. Whenever this attribute is not None the corresponding object is reconstructed from input files. See the specific objects __init__ methods for details.

  • type: str or None

input_folder¶

Absolute path corresponding to the folder containing the input_file file. It is automatically generated from the corresponding input_file. When the latter attribute is None, then it is set to None.

  • type: str or None

input_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file containing a saved object (see the dedicated save method of the different objects for details). It is automatically generated from the input_file attribute. When the latter attribute is None, then it is set to None.

  • type: str or None

input_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file containing a saved object log (see the dedicated save methods of the different objects for details). It is automatically generated from the input_file attribute. When the latter attribute is None, then it is set to None.

  • type: str or None

log¶

Dictionary containing a log of the calls to the object methods (creation, calculations, I/O, etc.). The dictionary has datetime strings as keys and actions as values. Actions are dictionaries, containing details of the methods calls.

  • type: dict

  • keys: datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]

  • values: dict with the following structure:

    • “action” (value type: str)

      Short description of the action.

    • other items representing details of the corresponding action

name¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument name (when present) or automatically generated from the object __init__ method. The attribute is set by the __check_define_name private method of each class. In general, the name attribute is generated with the following scheme:

Object

Input argument name

Attribute name

Histfactory

None

“model_”+<timestamp>+”_histfactory”

<str>

<str>+”_histfactory”

Likelihood

None

“model_”+<timestamp>+”_likelihood”

<str>

<str>+”_likelihood”

Sampler

not available

same name as input Lik

with “_likelihood” suffix replaced by “_sampler”

Data

None

“model_”+<timestamp>+”_data”

<str>

<str>+”_data”

DNNLikelihood

None

“model_”+<timestamp>+”_dnnlikelihood”

<str>

<str>+”_dnnlikelihood”

where <timestamp> is the string datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3] and suffixes are appended preventing duplication.

  • type: str

output_folder¶

Absolute path corresponding to the input argument output_folder. If the latter is None, then it is set to the code execution folder. This is the folder where the object is saved (see the save method of the different classes for details). If the folder does not exist it is created by the utils.check_create_folder function.

  • type: str

output_h5_file¶

Absolute path to the .h5 file where the object is saved (see the save_h5 method of the different classes for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute output_folder.

  • type: str

output_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file where the object is saved (see the save_json method of the different classes for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute output_folder.

  • type: str

output_log_file¶

Absolute path to the .log file where the object log stored in the log attribute is saved (see the save_log method of the different classes for details). It is automatically generated from the attribute output_folder.

  • type: str

output_predictions_json_file¶

Absolute path to the .json file where the predictions dictionary, containing predictions for the corresponding object is saved. It is automatically generated from the :attr:`output_folder <common_classes_attributes.output_folder> and :attr:`name <common_classes_attributes.name> attributes.

Notice that the file is only saved to provide human readable predictions. Indeed, the predictions dictionary is saved and restored together with the other attributes, in the :attr:`output_h5_file <common_classes_attributes.output_h5_file> file.

  • type: str

verbose¶

Attribute corresponding to the input argument verbose. It represents verbosity mode of the

__init__ method and the default verbosity mode of all class methods

that accept a verbose argument. See Verbosity mode for more details.

  • type: bool or int

pars_bounds¶

|Numpy_link| array containing the parameters bounds. For the

  • Likelihood

  • Data

objects it is set from the corresponding input argument pars_bounds. If the input argument is None then bounds for all parameters are set to [-np.inf,np.inf]. For the objects

  • Sampler

  • DNNLikelihood

it is automatically set from the corresponding attribute of the Likelihood and Data objects that are inherited by these classes respectively.

It is used by various methods to ensure/check that parameters lie within specified bounds.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,2)

pars_central¶

|Numpy_link| array containing central values of the parameters. For the

  • Likelihood

  • Data

objects it is set from the corresponding input argument pars_central. If the input argument is None then central values for all parameters are set to 0. For the objects

  • Sampler

  • DNNLikelihood

it is automatically set from the corresponding attribute of the Likelihood and Data objects that are inherited by these classes respectively.

It is used as initialization by several methods to perform MCMC and optimization.

  • type: numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (ndims,)

pars_labels¶

List containing parameters names as strings. For the

  • Likelihood

  • Data

objects it is set from the corresponding input argument pars_central. If the input argument is None then it is set equal to the automatically generated pars_labels_auto For the objects

  • Sampler

  • DNNLikelihood

it is automatically set from the corresponding attribute of the Likelihood and Data objects that are inherited by these classes respectively.

Parameters labels are always parsed as “raw” strings (like, for instance, r"%s"%pars_labels[0]) and can contain latex expressions that are properly compiled when making plots.

  • type: list

  • shape: (ndims,)

pars_labels_auto¶

List containing parameters names automatically generated by the function utils.define_pars_labels_auto. All parameters of interest are named r"$\theta_{i}$" with i ranging between one to the number of parameters of interest and all nuisance parameters are named r"$\nu_{j}$" with j ranging between one to the number of nuisance parameters.

Parameters labels are always parsed as “raw” strings (like, for instance, r"%s"%pars_labels_auto[0]) and can contain latex expressions that are properly compiled when making plots.

  • type: list

  • shape: (ndims,)

pars_pos_nuis¶

|Numpy_link| array containing the positions in the parameters list of the nuisance parameters. For the

  • Likelihood

  • Data

objects it is set from the corresponding input argument pars_pos_nuis. For the objects

  • Sampler

  • DNNLikelihood

it is automatically set from the corresponding attribute of the Likelihood and Data objects that are inherited by these classes respectively.

  • type: list or `numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_nuis,)

pars_pos_poi¶

|Numpy_link| array containing the positions in the parameters list of the parameters of interest. For the

  • Likelihood

  • Data

objects it is set from the corresponding input argument pars_pos_poi. For the objects

  • Sampler

  • DNNLikelihood

it is automatically set from the corresponding attribute of the Likelihood and Data objects that are inherited by these classes respectively.

  • type: list or `numpy.ndarray

  • shape: (n_nuis,)

ndims¶

Number of parameters on which the likelihood (or logpdf) depends, i.e. number of dimensions of the input vector X. It is automatically generated as explained in the following table:

Object

Method

Details

Likelihood

Lik.__check_define_ndims

The output of the logpdf function is evaluated by changing the dimension of the input vector, starting from one, until no error is raised.

Sampler

Sampler.__init_likelihood

It is set equal to the corresponding attribute of the Lik class.

Data

Data.__init__

It is set equal to the length of the first entry of the Data.data_X attribute.

DNNLikelihood

DNNLik.__set_data

It is set equal to the corresponding attribute of the Data class.

  • type: int

output_figures_base_file_name¶

Base name of the files to which figures are saved. It is automatically generated by appending the suffix “_figure” to the corresponding name attribute.

  • type: str

output_figures_base_file_path¶

Base name of the files to which figures are saved, including absolute path. It is automatically generated from the corresponding output_figures_base_file_name and output_figures_folder attributes.

  • type: str

output_figures_folder¶

Absolute path to the folder where figures are saved. It is automatically set to a subfolder, named “figures”, of the folder corresponding to the output_folder attribute.

  • type: str
